Notes: Two soldiers were killed after their truck ran over an Improvised Explosive Device at Handaro, Holugho sub-county, Garissa County. Three other soldiers who tried to jump off the vehicle were reportedly shot at close range by the suspected militia and were seriously wounded.
05 July. Several police officers were injured after their vehicle ran over a homemade bomb between Handaro and Sangailu on the Lamu-Garissa border. Al Shabaab suspected.

06 June. Five Kenyan paramilitary police were killed when their vehicle struck a homemade landmine in Liboi. Al Shabaab suspected as perpetrators. Al Shabaab claims they have killed 25 Kenyan soldiers. The attack began with an IED blast, which killed 22. Three others were shot by the attackers.
Movement of forces: 02 July. 200 members of al Shabaab are spotted moving through Boni Forest in eastern Kenya, near the border with Somalia.

Al Shabaab terrorists have set on fire two police camps in Ijara, in the latest attack from the Somalia-based militant group. The attackers also destroyed the main communication equipment used in the town before speeding off with a police land cruiser which is yet to be recovered. A senior police officer briefed on the matter has told Capital News beat that no casualty was reported in the attack.
On 09 October, five militants were kiled by the Kenyan Defence Force during a raid in Boni Forest. Others escaped with injuries.
The KDF engaged Al Shabaab fighters at Kolbio.
Al Shabab forces attacked the village of Damase in Garissa county and seized it fully after brief fighting with Kenyan police officers who fled the area during the fighting.

Heavily-armed al-Shabab mujahideen movement forces have launched a major attack on a village on the outskirts of the city of Garissa [northeast Kenya].Reports from the Somali-dominated NFD [Northern Frontier Districts] of Kenya say the attack caused heavy casualties.Kenyan government officials have not officially commented on the death toll from the attack. Sources say al-Shabab forces seized control of the village, known as Amuma, with Kenyan police officials also confirming the attack to the media.
The Kenya Defence Forces [KDF] on Sunday [20 August] resumed bombing Boni Forest which Al Shabaab has used as a base to launch attacks.

Five police officers have been killed by an Al-Shabaab IED while on patrol along Bothai-Ijara road, within Garissa County. One officer sustained injuries during the attack while another one managed to escape unhurt.

A powerful explosion caused by a land mine, occurred in parts of NFD [Northern Frontier District, Kenya'snortheastern region], targeting Kenyan military forces and resulting in casualties in an area called Abdi Ali in Liboi town.
The police have launched air strikes in Boni Forest to attack Al Shabaab fighters
A KDF convoy was transporting military supplies to Somalia when it was targeted in a massive roadside explosion, just outside of Liboi town. Several soldiers wounded.

At least three people were killed after a car they were travelling in hit a landmine along Dadaab-Kulan road in Garissa County [eastern Kenya]. Al Shabaab believed responsible. One person escaped with injuries. The Star reports four dead.

At last five police officers were killed and one other injured after an Improvised Explosive Devise tore their vehicle along the Malelei-Kulan Road in Liboi, Garissa County. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attacks
On 24 May, two police officers were killed in an explosion between Malelei and Kulan in Garissa, near Hagadera refugee camp
At least three policemen were killed in an IED explosions in Liboi, Garissa County, near the Kenya - Somalia border. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attacks.
At least four people died on Tuesday when their vehicle set off an improvised explosive device in a small Kenyan town near the border with Somalia, police said.Al-Shabaab militants were suspected

Further reports have emerged of the damage caused by an explosion that targeted a Kenyan army convoy in Garissa County, northeastern Kenya. The explosion which was a land mine attack was targeted on a Kenya army convoy in between Liboi town and Kulan village in Garissa county. Kenyan police said the explosion injured several soldiers with three sustaining serious injuries. The injured were airlifted to a hospital in the capital, Nairobi, for treatment. No one who has claimed responsibility for the attack given that al-Shabab has severally taken credit for attacks that have happened in northeastern Kenya.

At least six Kenyan security officers were injured in a bomb blast on Monday in the northeast region of Garissa near the Somali border. Somali militant group Al-Shabaab has claimed responsibility for the attack, saying its fighters killed four government soldiers, including two commanders.
Source: Xinhua General News Service; Ghana News Agency (GNA)

Notes: Five people were injured when suspected al-Shabab militants sprayed their vehicle with bullets between Bodhei and Ijara, on the border of Lamu and Garissa counties.
Women from Boni were abducted and held by Al Shabaab militants in a camp, where they were gang-raped and mistreated.
Al-Shabaab militants burned down a school and abducted two teachers in an overnight attack in Fafi, Garissa. One teacher is killed.
One dead and three injured when an ambulance hit a suspected al-Shabaab planted land mine in Hulugho.

A convoy transporting Kenyan defence forces (KDF) was targeted in a roadside bomb explosion outside Liboi town near Somali border by suspected al Shabaab. The bomb blast has destroyed one of vehicles in the convoy, causing unidentified casualties as Kenyan military did not comment on the IED attack.
Movement of forces: Al Shabaab enters two villages in Ijara sub-county, forcing residents to hear a lecture in their local mosque.
Al Shabaab attacked Haluqa, outside of Garissa, targeting a Safaricom building. The attackers abducted several workers and took them into Somalia.
Al Shabaab overtakes Bula Golol in Garissa Country without resistance, then begins preaching to the residents. Military forces had fled the area prior to the al Shabaab arrival.
A soldier was killed and six others injured in the border town of Hulugho after an Al Shabaab IED detonated. Al Shabaab, in taking credit, claims eight dead.
Al Shabaab kidnaps a teacher at a refugee camp Hagadera. The victim was rescued four days later.
A teacher is kidnapped by suspected al Shabaab in Hagadera refugee camp. The teacher was later rescued by Kenyan forces across the border into Somalia.

Al Shabaab gunmen attack Garissa University during the morning hours in an operation that lasted the majority of the day. Almost all of the 148 people killed were students and another 79 people were injured.

Three IEDs were detonated in the vicinity of firewood distribution centre in IFO 1 (Dadaab District) in the morning of 08/12. Reports indicate that the first explosion targeted the rear police escort vehicle of the regular morning convoy to IFO 1 and Dagahaley. The second set targeted the police responders, of whom a number had by then arrived at the scene. No one was injured by any of the blasts. The police vehicle initially targeted by the perpetrators only sustained slight damages. There were gunshots fired by the police after the second explosion. One man was injured in its aftermath, trampled by a panicked crowd running from the scene.

A khat driver is kidnapped by al Shabaab while three of his colleagues were attacked, robbed and released as they travelled in or near Bothai, possibly Kiunga. It was later learned the driver was beheaded sometime later.
Two casual laborious were shot dead by unknown assailants, later suspected to al Shabaab in the outskirts of Garissa town on the evening of 13/08.
Suspected al-Shabaab militants hurled grenades in co-ordinated attacks against civilians in Garissa town Tuesday evening (May 20th), injuring ten people.

Two to four armed men, suspected to be al Shabaab, approached a vehicle (a UN agency vehicle) of the Kambioos-bound convoy stationed along the Hagadera hospital road and shot the driver on the right arm in the morning of 23/04. The second occupant of the car, an expatriate staff managed to get off the car and ran towards the nearest INGO compound for help. Both of the driver and the expatriate are currently safe with the driver undergoing treatment at the Hagadera hospital. The perpetrators escaped with the vehicle and drove south-east of Hagadera for approximately 30 km when the vehicle was remotely disabled, prompting the perpetrators to leave the car. Police reached the scene and were combing the area for the perpetrators. The attack was ;later revealed to be a kidnapping attempt against the UN staffers.

An explosive device believed to be an IED targeted a police vehicle in the vicinity of Juba Primary School in Dagahley Camp in Dadaab District in the morning of 30/12. The police vehicle was escorting an NGO vehicle carrying out borehole refuelling. One police officer was reportedly injured by the explosion. The vehicle was severely damaged.
Three suspected bombers killed when the bomb they were planting blew up. The police suspect a link with Al Shabaab
IED explodes in Dadaab refugee camp, injuring three police officers
Two suspected Al Shabaab bombers died when explosives they were carrying went off
Al Shabaab launches an attack on a border town, killing three civilians and five police. Liboi hosts an AMISOM military, often used to supply forces in Somalia.

Two masked men armed with AK type rifles came to a small cinema in block N-29 of IFO 1 in Dadaab District in the night of 17/10. The motive of the attack is unknown. Six people were injured in the attack. The perpetrators escaped. It is believed the attackers are affiliated with al Shabaab.

Suspected al Shabaab attack Ifo refugee camp in Dadaab, targeting an international aid organization staff residence in the refugee camp, which is one among the five open air complex camps in region. There was no injury.

40 people, including two government officials, were held hostage by gunmen suspected to be al Shabaab militia from Somalia in Hullugho border town. The gunmen apprehended the group while the were travelling from Masalani.
Suspected al Shabaab gunmen kill two Kenyans who were carrying supplies near the border with Somalia
Suspected Al Shabaab gunmen kill seven people who were on their way to prayers at a mosque
Gunmen with suspected links to Al Shabab attack hotel; five killed
Armed group linked to Al Shabaab attacks military and kills one
Al Shabaab members kill three Kenyan soldiers

Somali Islamist rebels stormed a remote police camp in northeastern Kenya, killing seven people and kidnapping three. The town was four miles from the border and known as Gerille. Among the dead were three police, a civil servant, school teacher and a pregnant woman.
Explosive device planted near voter registration centre injures one
IED attack blamed on al Shabaab; police and civilians injured
Vehicle in refugee camp hits explosive device; six wounded
IED explodes in Dadaab refugee camp. Human rights leader thought to be the target
Suspected RCIED detonated killing one police officer as they were accompanying NGO workers.
Weapons Seizure: Suspected Al Shabaab sympathizers hijack public service vehicle near Somali border
Grenade attack on church blamed on Al Shabaab
Suspected Al Shabaab militants kill mobile phone company employee
Gunmen kill official in refugee camp; perpetrators believed to be linked to Al Shabaab
Seventeen killed in church attack; Al Shabaab claimed responsibility though investigators did not confirm that they were involved
Foreign aid workers kidnapped and Kenyan driver killed in attack thought to be the work of Al Shabaab

Somali Islamist rebels stormed a remote police camp in northeastern Kenya, killing seven people and kidnapping three. The town was four miles from the border and known as Gerille. Among the dead were three police, a civil servant, school teacher and a pregnant woman.
Kenyan police make a second raid in the same area and kill 12 suspected al Shabaab fighters, and arrest several more.
Kenyan police kill six al Shabaab fighters, wound six others and make several arrests during a raid.

Somalias Al-Shabab militia crossed into Kenya and attacked a police station. The attackers launched a rocket-propelled grenade on the Liboi Police Station at the Liboi border in, northeastern, but no injury was reported.
A remote controlled blast in a refugee camp kills one police officer and injures two others.
A landmine blast kills a civilian and a police officer near a camp. Al Shabaab is believed to be responsible.
A roadside style bomb explodes near a military transport wounding four passengers. Al Shabaab believed to be involved.
A child is killed and three others injured when the group came across a hand grenade when they were grazing their animals.
A member of Al Shabaab shoots and kills a UNHCR official in a refugee camp. Five were later arrested.

A Kenyan herder was on Friday killed in Somalia by members of the Islamist group Al Shabaab for refusing to part with his five camels as payment for a yearly tax. He is reported to have been shot on the head several times before his entire stock of camels was confiscated.
Al-Shabab members clash with police and security forces at a Kenya-Somalia border town.
Arrests: Kenyan police arrest dozens men believed to be in connection with the recent Ugandan bombing in the city of Kampala.
Property destruction: Al Shabaab raids a desolate Kenyan border town, attack two hotels causing property damage, but no causalities.

Suspected Somali Islamist militia attacked Kenyan policemen holding three men, including two British nationals of Somali extraction, who had crossed into Kenya illegally. LOCATION: Liboi and nearby Dajajabula, Dhoobley areas (Kenyan side of the border wi

Non-violent activity: Al Shabaab reportedly erects a series of road blocks between Garba Tula and Modogashe townships [north-eastern Kenya] for purposes of extorting money from motorists. Despite these assertions, the local government denies these claims. Exact date unknown.
Al Shabaab lines and executes 15 non-Muslim farmers by firing squad in Mado Gashi.
Reports claim that police bombed civilians while pursuing bandits
Two more bombs were found in Ngong on Monday, a few hours after a fifth victim of Sundays blast died in hospital.

Four children were killed on Sunday and another seriously hurt when an explosive device they found in an empty field with went off. The device, which police described as an anti-personnel bomb -- the round fired from a mortar -- was almost certainly an unexploded munition from the nearby Ngong Range, used for training by the military and police.
Police kill two terror suspects in shoot-out.

A student leader is killed after a bomb explodes in his dorm room. It is possible that this incident was an accident, but it could be intentional, as his had a history of political involvement and had received death threats in the past.
29 December: Two children were killed by explosive devices while herding in Samburu. No group has claimed responsibility
On 10 October, gunmen killed two female employees of a university in Ukunda, in a suspected extremist attack.
Al Shabaab attacks and kills a civilian in their home in Mbuwani.

Armed men believed to be members of Al-Shabaab have killed three people in Kwale in Kenyas coastal region. The Kenyan government said the people killed were elders. Reports say that masked armed men arrived at the coastal town and hounded the people out of their homes and killed them in an open field.
Grenade attack blamed on Al Shabaab injures three

On September 25th, a pro-Al Shabaab radio station reported that Al Shabaab forces had attacked a KDF camp at Taksile, north of Lamu (coordinates for Lamu used). According to the source, 10 KDF soldiers were killed, and three Al Shabaab fighters were also killed.

24 September 2018: Al-Shabaab militants claim to have overrun a Kenyan military base in Taksile area north of Pandaguo, Lamu County, killing 10 Kenyan soldiers and admitting three deaths among their own ranks. Kenyan military sources also reported the clashes, although they claimed that 10 Al-Shabaab fighters had been killed. Fatalities coded at the most conservative estimate.
Kenyan officials said a civilian was killed and several policemen wounded when suspected members of the Somalia-based group al-Shabaab attacked a convoy of vehicles.
On December 8th, three civilians were injured when their lorry was hit by an IED near Sankuri (Lamu county). The device was suspected to have been planted by Al Shabaab.
On or before October 2nd, Al Shabaab forces shelled a Kenyan military base in Mirarani (Lamu county). Casualties mentioned (unknown death or injuries coded as zero fatalaties).
On 8 August, five Kenyan soldiers were killed and six others wounded when their vehicle was blown up by an IED near the town of Bodhei. Al-Shabaab claimed the attack.

Property destruction: on August 24th, and according to an Al Shabaab commander, the group destroyed power stations in Lamu town and Tana River town (for the latter, the location of Hola has been used). There has been no confirmation of this claim in other sources.
Armed groups killed a woman and injured five police officers at Nyongoro along the Lamu-Malindi road

Two Administration Police officers have died while three others have been injured after suspected Al-Shabaab militants ambushed an escort vehicle they were travelling in at Lango La Simba in Nyongoro, along the Lamu-Malindi road.
Police officers engaged in a shoot out with Al Shabaab, after a landmine injured civilians in Nyorongo

At least three police officers and one Al shabaab member were killed after Al Shabaab raided Pandanguo Police Camp in Lamu. Al Shabaab engaged in a gun battle with the police that lasted for hours. One police officer was unaccounted for. Al Shabaab planted IEDs while raiding the station. Government troops were later deployed to Lamu to look for al-Shabab. The Kenya Standard claims 2 police dead in the attack.
Source: Capital FM; Agence France Presse; BBC Monitoring via al Shabaabs Twitter account; Kenya Standard

Notes: At least one police officer was killed and two others injured when the vehicle in which they were travelling ran over an improvised explosive device (IED) in the coastal Lamu County on Sunday evening.
Two people were injured after the vehicle they were travelling in ran over a landmine at Nyongoro along the Garsen-Lamu road.
Seven police officers and a civilian were killed when an armoured vehicle drove over a roadside bomb in southeastern Kenya. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility
Al Shabaab militants destroyed an electricity pylon near Gamba, causing a blackout across Lamu county.
Detonation: The IED planted by Al Shabaab, and targeting Kenya Defence Forces (KDF) along the Milimani-Baure's supply route detonated without any casualties or injuries on the side of KDF.

Reports from Lamu Island say a deadly attack was carried out in parts of the island. The attack was a well-planned ambush targeting a vehicle carrying "Kenyan crusaders" travelling on the road that connects Mwitu and Gamba villages in Lamu county. Al-Shabab forces, who are waging jihad in Lamu, captured the vehicle and two Kenyan infidels, who are among those settled in the Muslim land of Lamu.
Five people are nursing multiple gunshot wounds after their vehicle was shot at by suspected al Shabaab militants
Four people were killed by suspected Al Shabaab militia in two villages in the Hindi area in Lamu county. Police have lauched an investigation.
Four people were killed by suspected Al Shabaab militia in Lamu county. Police have lauched an investigation.
At least three people were killed on Friday by Al Shabaab militants in Witu Lamu County. The Star reports 4 dead.
Al Shabaab militants attacked Maleli village, near Witu town. They burned down houses and killed 4 people.
Three people were killed and four injured after a passenger bus was ambushed by Al Shabaab.
Al Shabaab kill two civilians while attacking civilians in the Mararani area.
Three people were killed and several were injured including Public Works Principal Secretary Mariam El Maawy, during an ambush by Al Shabaab attack in Lamu West.
Four men have been beheaded by Al Shabaab at Jima area bordering Pandanguo in Lamu county. Kenya Standard reports 9 people were beheaded and the event took place on the previous day.
Source: BBC Monitoring via al Shabaabs Twitter account; Kenya Standard

Notes: At least nine people were killed in Lamu County on Saturday morning, in an attack by Al Shabaab. The attack occurred at Jima and Pandaguo village near the border with Somalia

At least nine people were killed in Lamu County on Saturday morning, in an attack by Al Shabaab. The attack occurred at Jima and Pandaguo villages near the border with Somalia. At Jima, Al Shabaab beheaded four men (coded in other event).
Source: Capital FM; BBC Monitoring via al Shabaabs Twitter account

Notes: A Muslim cleric died on Saturday evening after his vehicle hit an improvised explosive device (IED) in the Kenyan coastal county of Lamu, near the border with Somalia. Al Shabaab are the suspected perpetrators.
Six police (or seven - Shabelle Media Network) officers are killed when their vehicle struck an IED in Lamu, suspected al Shabaab responsible.
Al Shabaab attacks Pandanguo village, targeting the homes of Christians. Al Shabaab claimed "many" killed, though more reliable reports indicate three dead, plus injuries.
Reports indicate that Al Shabaab overtook Milimani village in Lamu on the night of 18/07. No violence was reported.
An al Shabaab-planted explosive attached to a military vehicle causes seven soldier deaths.
Al Shabaab targets police with an IED in Lamu on 13/07. Three deaths reported.
Three KDF members are injured in an al Shabaab IED attack Milimani on 21/06.
In response to recent attacks in the Lamu area, Kenya air forces launch attacks on Lamu Forest, believed to be where the suspected assailants are hiding. Causalities not known.
Non-violent activity: Suspected al Shabaab attack a Lamu bound bus in Nyangoro. Four shots were reported fired, though no one was reported injured.

Five passengers in two Miraa [mild narcotic] vans from Lamu to Ijara town were during the morning hours hijacked by suspected al Shabaab militia, which was later confirmed. The incident took place between Milimani and Basuba area in Lamu East sub-county. The five were taken to an unknown location. Kenyan security forces launched a search mission in response.
Al Shabaab attacks and kills two, steals vehicles at Basuba location, Lamu East. Security forces later launched a security sweep of the area.
At least 21 people have been killed in new attacks late in the day in Kenyas Lamu coastal region. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

Between 10 and 15 suspected al Shabaab assailants attack Witu. A witness said that the attackers shot their victims first, made sure they bled, before tying them up and making them lie on the ground facing down. They then proceeded to hack them. The attackers are said to have vowed that they were not going to leave until they eliminate all non-believers from the area. At least 11 dead. The attack may have occurred in Maleli. As a result of the attacks, many of the residents have fled the area.

Somali al Shabaab carjack two police vans in Witu, drive to Mpekatoni where they began opening fire on people in the street. It was later learned the attackers singled out-non Muslims before they opened fire. Areas affected were Mpeketoni Police station, two hotels, a bank and a fuel station. One of the hotels was burnt down in the attack. It is not clear if police forces returned fire. Out of the 60 people reported missing after the Mpeketoni clashes 8 people are yet to be accounted for. At least 57 people died in the attack.
Movement of forces: Concerns that Somali Al Shabaab fighters escaping to Kenya and hiding among the civilian population

Kenyan police arrested five men suspected of being members of Somalias al Qaeda-linked al Shabaab insurgents on the island of Lamu, close to where two tourists were kidnapped and taken to Somalia earlier in the year.
25 December: Al Shabaab claimed to have killed two Kenyan police and injured three others in Mandera town.

03 May. Al Shabaab attacks Mandera, killing four 'non-Muslim' quarry workers. Several other injuries reported. The police later "rescued" 150 workers involved in the incident. However, it is not certain if any of the workers were held hostage at any point.

Al-Shabab has claimed responsibility for an attack on a Kenyan police station located along the common border in Mandera on 2 January. "Reports from al-Shabab Mujahideen say that six soldiers (police) were killed in the attack with one being the commander of the police in the area, four were killed in the raid on the police camp while two other soldiers were killed in an ambush while they were rushing to back up their colleagues from El Waq town," the website reported.

On October 16th, Al Shabaab militants alleged that they had destroyed two Kenyan military vehicles with an IED, killing and injuring an unspecified number of soldiers. The alleged incident took place between Fino and Arabiya villages in Mandera county (coordinates for Fino, Mandera, used). Subsequent reports indicate that the IED exploded before the military vehicles were in range, resulting in no casualties or fatalities.
26 September 2018: An IED hit a Kenyan military vehicle in Daba-city village in Mandera County.
On 13 August, al-Shabaab destroyed a Kenyan police vehicle which was driving through Yadi, Damase and El Wak towns in Mandera with an IED, killing tens of soldiers aboard the vehicle.

On 2nd July, a Kenyan military vehicle was hit by an IED (the source attributes the attack to Al Shabaab) on the road between Mandera and Lafey, 5km from Lafey. Fatalaties are unclear (coded at low estimate of 3). An additional IED was safely dismantled by Kenyan army reinforcements in the area later that same day.
08 May. A suspected al Shabaab IED targets a military convoy in Daba Siti. One soldier dead.
14 March. A roadside IED results in two KDF soldiers killed and an unspecified number and an unspecific number wounded. Perpetrating actor not named by the source.
Al Shabaab fire several mortar rounds towards KDF base in El Ram, Mandera County. No casualties, assailants escaped.
Al Shabaab launched mortar file against a military base in El Wak over two days. Casualties reported, number not provided.
Al Shabaab launched mortar file against a military base in El Wak over two days. Casualties reported, number not provided.

A Kenyan official says four children have been killed by an explosive device that went off in a field where they grazing livestock. Mandera Governor Ali Roba is blaming devices that Britain might have planted during its colonial occupation of Kenya for the deaths on Saturday. He asked security agents to clear the fields of any devices from before Kenya gained independence in 1963.
Looting: 24 May. Al Shabaab invaded Mandera, looted shops and lectured in a mosque for several hours before leaving.

Property destruction: Al-Shabab militants have destroyed a Hormuud communication mast located on the Somalia border town of Elwak. Police say the militants were retaliating to earlier reports of locals communicating with Somalia security forces and the Kenya Amisom troops.

On October 10th, around twenty militants suspected to belong to Al Shabaab attacked a school in Lafey (Mandera). The militants targeted non-Muslim staff, and threw an explosive device into quarters used by non-Muslim teachers, killing two.

03 May. Al Shabaab attacks Mandera, killing four 'non-Muslim' quarry workers. Several other injuries reported. The police later "rescued" 150 workers involved in the incident. However, it is not certain if any of the workers were held hostage at any point.

Transport in Mandera County has been paralysed after operators suspended bus services in the county for three days after al-Shabab attacked two police vehicles on Monday evening. Al-Shabab militants ambushed and burnt down two police land cruisers in an attack in Daba City, Mandera County on Monday. The two vehicles carrying police officers were escorting a bus to Mandera when they were hit by rocket-propelled grenades. 12 killed, several wounded.

Kenya Defence Forces (KDF) and police exchanged fire with Al Shabaab militants after they destroyed a telecommunication mast in Mandera County. The police reservists were overpowered by the attackers as they engaged in gunfight but none was injured during the 1:30 a.m. attack at Dabacity area. A loud explosion was heard and police reservists guarding the mast reported an attack at Dabacity by the militants but none of the police reservists was injured in the incident.
A Police Officer was killed during an attempted attack by Al-Shabaab at Lafey police station. Some of Al-Shabaab members suffered injuries when police responded wih gunshots. A police car was stolen
Police officers exchanged fire with Al Shabaab after they attacked the Equity Back in Elwak Town. Five police reported dead.

Al Shabaab militants raided Omar Jilo, in northern Kenya, where they clashed with police forces. 2 local administrators were killed and 2 police reservists were abducted. Security personnel are pursuing the attackers.

Schoolchildren were playing with a device when it exploded. At least five children have been killed in an explosion in Banisa, Mandera County. Banisa Sub-County Deputy County Commissioner Mathias Chisambo said the schoolchildren were playing with a grenade they had found in a grazing field.

At least two KDF soldiers were killed on 28 August when their Armoured Personnel Carrier (APC) triggered off a roadside bomb explosion in Damasa Lafey Sub-County, Mandera [northeast of the country]. Three others were injured.
An Improvised Device (IED) exploded when a vehicle ran over it. The vehicle was heading to Mandera from Elwak. No one was injured in the attack.
Four cilivilians killed and 11 injured when a passenger bus struck a roadside bomb suspected to have been planted by Al Shabaab between Lafey and Elwak in Madera county.

At least five policemen were killed in an IED explosions in Mandera, near the Kenya - Somalia border. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attacks. Police later arrested several Al-Shabaab suspects behind the attacks in Mandera county. One of the susptect is a high ranking Al-Shabaab explosives expert

A Kenyan official was killed on Wednesday after a vehicle he was traveling in ran over an improvised explosive device in Elwak area near Kenya-Somalia border. Mandera East divisional police commander Timothy Muasya said the explosive device was buried on the ground by unknown people. The driver survived with serious injuries after the 1 p.m. incident. Police have blamed the attacks on Al-Shabaab militants who are operating in the area.

At least two children were killed and three others injured on 25/03 after explosion went off in a unnamed village in Mandera county. Authorities suspect al Shabaab, though no group has claimed responsibility.
Non-violent activity: 10 April, 23:00EAT, Mandera, Kenya: al Shabaab militants entered Mandera and hijacked two pick-up trucks.
Movement of forces: Suspected Al-Shabaab hijacked a Kenyan government vehicle in the border town of Elwak in Mandera country. The attackers released the driver and reportedly drove into Somalia.
Al Shabaab militants attacked a land cruiser in Arabia. They stole the land cruiser and shot at the passengers. 2 passengers were injured.
Al Shabaab militants hijacked a car and abducted a driver between Fino and Sheikh Barrow. He is alive, but being held in Somalia.
A Land Cruiser carrying five passengers was attacked by Al Shabaab militants at Arabia area. The driver was released and two passengers suffered gunshot wounds but they were in stable condition.
Suspected Al Shabaab militants hijacked 2 cars carrying voters between Omar Jillo and Lafey.
Al Shabaab militants hijacked a car painted in Jubilee campaign colours in Falana, near Mandera. The driver and a passenger were kidnapped.
Five people were killed when Al Shabaab atacked the Equity bank In Elwak Town.

A security operation is underway in Mandera town [northeastern Kenya] after a chief said to be instrumental in the war against terror was gunned down by people believed to be al-Shabab militia. The heavily armed al-Shabab militants are said to have raided the home of the chief in Omar Jillo location, Lafey sub-county in Mandera East before killing him on the spot. The military and the police have teamed up in an operation to comb Mandera in search of the assailants
Suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked a village in Mandera and killed a chief before abducting two police reservists on Monday night.
Two quarry workers were shot dead Friday and one was missing in a suspected extremist attack in Kenya's northern county of Mandera, a government official said.
Al Shabaab militants attacked El Wak town. 2 people were killed.

Three people are injured in Mandera after their fuel tanker ran over an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) between Kotulo and Chuma Mrefu. Al Shabaab suspected. A similar attack against police occurred earlier in the week.
Suspected al Shabaab target police with an IED in Mandera. No causalities.

Al Shabaab gunmen detonated explosives at Boshari Guesthouse during the early morning hours. Twelve killed, others injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility, saying the targets of their attacks were Christians. Police later imposed a dusk till dawn curfew.

Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for double roadside explosions targeted Kenyan defence forces near the town of Mandera on 09/09. Pro-al shabaab media outlets, citing unnamed commander reported that at least 4 Kenyan army soldiers died in the IED blasts on the KDF military convoy.
Al Shabaab are reported to have struck Damasa border town and destroyed a Safaricom communication mast and a water pump using explosives. No reported human causality or violence.

An IED detonated at Mandera, near the Somali border on 11/06. No causalities reported. The Mandera County Commissioner said the incident, which took place at Border Point Three area near custom offices, had targeted security officers manning the border area and was likely caused by al Shabaab.
A cross-border al Shabaab attack kills six in Mandera. The attackers targeted "non-locals" and/or "Christians."
A woman was killed while three others were critically injured when suspected Al-Shabaab gunmen attacked a vehicle between Fino and Lafey at around 7pm on Saturday night.
Eight Kenyans have been kidnapped by the al-Shabab militants in the past month in the Alango and Kurokura (Mandera County) areas. Dates unknown, though the latest kidnapping took place on 10/07.
Al Shabaab creates a heavy presence in Lafey village effectively "taking over" the village. The presence of al Shabaab caused several villagers to flee for safety.

Three people were killed and two others injured after an explosion went off in a vehicle within Mandera town on 28/12. Al Shabaab suspected. The explosion caused a group of locals to hold a demonstration against military forces, mistakenly believing members of the military had been responsible for the deaths of the civilians.

A member of al Shabaab, attempting to plant a roadside bomb, dies when the device exploded prematurely. The perpetrator was believed to be hurried when he saw that the police had noticed his activities and attempted top stop him. A matter of dispute, the Daily Nation reported police had killed the perpetrator, followed by the explosion.

A roadside bomb or landmine, suspected to have origin with al Shabaab, detonates in Mandara, targeting and killing a group of five (later determined to be seven) police officers. The landmine was planted inside the customs and border compound. The attack come a day after an ambush on a group of soldiers in the town.
An IED explodes in Mandera following a similar attack across the Somali border in Beled Hawo. No reported causalities.
Non-violent activity: Ten armed members of al Shabaab hijack a bus carrying ten passengers, deboard them and take the bus across the border into Somalia. No violence reported.
Al Shabaab attacks and kills bus two travellers and wounds three others south of Mandera between Kotulo and Daba (Another report indicate the attacks occurred near El Wak) in Mandera County on 21/12.

Al Shabaab attacks Mandera town, throwing grenades into homes while people slept on 07/07. 14 dead. Al Shabaab later officially claimed responsibility, declaring they were specifically targeting Christians.
One person was killed and two others injured in an attack by suspected Al-Shabaab gunmen in Mandera Town on the night of 26/06. All of the victims are "non-locals," origin not known.
Suspected Somali Al-Shabaab kidnapped two Kenyan teachers on the evening of 24/04 in the Mandera border town.

Heavily armed gunmen suspected to be members of Al-Shabaab on the morning of 23/04 kidnapped senior Arabia chief in Mandera County along the Mandera-Arabia road. The chief was driven across the border into Somalia where he was killed at Gadoon Dhowe, Beled Xawo District.
Al Shabaab carries out the second attack in two days in Mandera. One death, three injuries reported. In the following days the death total was raised from 1 to 4.

Three people were killed and eight more wounded when al Shabaab launched a cross-border raid on a convoy carrying Mandera county governor Ali Roba. The governor escaped unharmed. The convoy was travelling either to or from Nairobi.

One person was killed and two others injured in an attack by suspected Al-Shabaab gunmen in Mandera Town on the night of 25/02. The victims were witnessed crossing from nearby Somalia at an earlier date and are suspected to be Somalis

A pro-al Shabaab website published a report that al Shabaab has claimed the responsibility of the killing of 36-non local Kenyans at a quarry in Koromei area near Mandera in the night of 01/12. The statement claimed that the attack on Koromei was part of series of attacks executed by the Mujahidin to serve as a response to Kenyas occupation of Somalia, the airstrikes by Kenyan warplanes and the killing of innocent Somalis.

A senior Kenyan county official escaped death narrowly after an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) exploded as he was being driven to his office in the border town of Rhamu, Mandera. Perpetrators not known. Two injuries reported.
Six are reported injured following a explosion near a hospital in Mandera. Perpatrators unknown, though the attack may be related to a nearby ethnic clash between Garre and Degodia clans.

At least 28 people were killed after suspected Al-Shabaab militants attacked a Nairobi-bound bus in Omar Jilo, Mandera County in north-east Kenya. Witness said the attackers ordered all off the bus, divided the passengers along ethnic lines - Somali and non-Somali, shooting all non-Somalis. Many of the deceased were teachers.
Al-Shabaab fighters have reportedly kidnapped 22 people from North-eastern Kenyan district of Mandera. The perpetrators later released the group after taking their possessions.
Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed a quarry worker before fleeing into Somalia. Authorities speculate the motive for the attack is related to the presence of Kenya troops in Somalia.
Suspected al Shabaab, numbering 5, killed a road construction worker in Mandera County before fleeing across the border into Somalia.

Gunmen hurled explosives at the Mandera county government headquarters causing damages. The buildings wing that houses finance and other executive offices was destroyed in the attack. Perpetrators believed to be al Shabaab. No injuries reported.
A group of 30 members of suspected al Shabaab attack a power station. Police respond, killing two and recovering weapons. It is nor clear if there were any civilian injuries.

One person was shot dead and another is fighting for his life at the Mandera Hospital after sustaining serious head injuries after suspected al Shabaab shot them at close range. (Though authorities believe al Shabaab is responsible, they also speculate job rivalry may have been a motive for the attack.
A young boy is killed and three others injured after a landmine detonated in Mandera border town. The group many have been playing with the mine, not aware that it was dangerous.
A device suspected to be an IED exploded in front of the Central AP camp in Mandera in the evening of 05/09. No casualties were reported.
Roadside bomb placed by unknown group kills police officer
Al Shabaab attacks quary workers near Mandera on 02/12, killing 38.
Al Shabaab attacks a civilian bus near Mandera, killing 28

Al Shabaab militants shoot and kill two civilians at Mandera, a Kenya/Somali border town. On Thursday night, two police officers were seriously injured after a hand grenade was hurled into their vehicle.
Al Shabaab militants attack village and hijack vehicles
Suspected Al Shabaab attackers kill soldier

Suspected Al Shabaab militia attacked a Kenyan police post, about 80 km from northern town of Mandera along the common border on Friday. About 35 gunmen attack Arabia Administration Police Post at around 22:00, sparking an exchange of fire.
Suspected Al Shabaab militants attack Kenyan police post near Somali border
Explosion injures police officers; officials suspect al Shabaab
Police beat villagers after IED explodes near police vehicle
Police officers patroling Kenya-Somalia border hit by remote-controlled explosive device they suspect was planted by Al Shabaab
Four Kenyan soldiers were wounded Monday when a landmine exploded beneath their vehicle in the northeastern Mandera region
Somali youth set landmine at Kenyan army base; several soldiers injured
Four police officers escape death when their vehicle drives over a buried explosive.
Two Kenyan government officials escaped death narrowly after the car in which they were patrolling in missed a remote controlled explosive device in the eastern town of Mandera bordering Somalia.
Angry residents take up arms to battle raiding Al-Shabab fighters
Woman injured in grenade attack by suspected Al Shabaab
Suspected Al Shabaab fighters attack Kenyan driver in NE Kenya
Al-Shabab raid mosque in Kenya and injure civilians
Al Shabaab fighters raid a police camp and make away with weapons.
Kenyan police arrest 50 al Shabaab suspects in the northeast.
Kenyan police arrest 20 suspects believed to be in connection with an attack on a bus which killed four people.
Nine military officers injured and one police officer killed in twin al Shabaab explosions. The single fatality was in Mandera.

At least 12 soldiers were injured and one dead after a military vehicle they were boarding was hit by a land mine in Mandera, a town in northern Kenya bordering Somalia and Ethiopia. Al Shabaab is believed to be responsible.

A policeman was killed in Mandera and three others injured when suspected al Shabab insurgents attacked them with an explosive device on the Kenya-Somalia border. Three civilians were also killed in the blast.
Kenyan security forces are conducting security operations in Mandera after a vehicle belonging to Kenyan security forces was targeted with a bomb explosion last night. Four soldiers were killed.
A seven-year-old boy was killed while two others were injured in a mortar shell explosion in Mandera. The explosive is suspected to have been left behind after fighting by Somali factions.

A motor bomb was thrown on Monday night [14 March] in Mandera town and later followed by sporadic gunfire that lasted almost ten minutes from neighboring Bulawayo town on the border of Kenya and Somalia. Police said five residents were seriously injured. The incident came days after Al-Shabab warned that it would attack Kenya in retaliation for training soldiers for the Transitional Federal Government of Somalia.

A bomb exploded at the Mandera District Hospital [northeastern Kenya] as heavy fighting continued on Kenyas border with Somalia and Ethiopia Thursday [24 February]. The explosion did not cause casualties, said North Eastern Provincial Commissioner [PC] James ole Serian, but four Kenyans were treated for bullet wounds.

Movement of forces: Unconfirmed reports indicate that an AS battalion of elite forces has been deployed in Bulo-Xawo and that operatives from the AS intelligence services (Amniyat) were being deployed in Mandera town.

Thirty people are reported to have been killed in the Thursday [21 October] night clashes between Al Shabaab and a pro-government Somali militia on the Kenya-Somali border, with two Kenyans slightly injured in the clashes.

Ca. 20 unidentified Somalian bandits attacked - Government quaters building bombed - 2 government vehicles. No injuries reported/ motive not know. LOCATION: Elwak town in Mandera District (district capital = Mandera)
Police forces arrest five suspected members of the al-Shabab militant organization.
Police officer and his driver killed by a landmine in Marsabit. 8 officers and 2 civilians seriously injured.
Source: Kenyan KBC; UN Integrated Regional Information Networks

Notes: Government official killed by landmines planted presumably by armed bandits

Movement of forces: In July, Al Shabaab forces were reported to have moved into Meru county from Somalia, according to a local official, who has also claimed Al Shabaab were planning attacks in the area.

Anti-terror police shot dead wanted Al Shabaab member Hussein Said Omar. He was one of the Al Shabaab militants behind the Mpeketoni attack that claimed lives of more than 60 people in June 2014. He engaged security personnel in a shootout from his hideout in Bamburi before he was shot dead by the police. The event took place on 18/08 or before.

Four people were killed and several others injured in twin attacks in Mombasa. One blast occurred at a well-known beach hotel, the Reef Hotel, in the Nyari area of the city, and the other in the Mwembe Tayari area, near the city centre. Al Shabaab is suspected.
A bomb was in the early morning hurled at a primary school in Likoni, Mombasa. Police say the device exploded inside the school compound, but no injuries have been reported.

Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed four people attending a church service in Likoni, outside of Mombasa. Many more were reported wounded. In the following days the death toll was raised to six. Police forces launched a large operation which yielded the arrests of 59 suspects.
Muslim cleric linked with Al Shabaab killed in shoot-out with police
Unidentified group kills member of Al Shabaab in Majengo slums
Attackers suspected to be linked to Al Shabaab throw grenade into church compound, injuring civilians
Police arrest Aboud Rogo Mohammed and seize a cache of illegal firearms.
Non-violent activity: Al Shabaab assembles IEDs in Majengo
Grenade attack by suspected Al Shabaab militant leaves three dead and many injured at pub outside Mombasa
Police arrest four members of Al Shabaab who planned attacks on churches over Christmas.
Unknown group bombs night club.

Actor1: The Government of Universal Palestine in Exile
Notes: A Palestinian militant group fires missiles at Israeli airliner.
Fifteen die when an unidentified Islamic militia detonate explosions at Mombasas Israeli-owned Paradise Hotel.

Nairobi: Ten people were killed and over 70 wounded in two bomb attacks at a busy market in Nairobi. According to authorities, first blast in the capital occurred next to a 14-seater matatu, or public minibus, and the second was inside a shop in Gikomba Market close to Nairobis central business district. Al Shabaab are suspected as perpetrators. Preceding the attack the British government had issued a travel advisory due to threats. Police forces launch a manhunt operation for the perpetrators the following day.

Nairobi: Ten people were killed and over 70 wounded in two bomb attacks at a busy market in Nairobi. According to authorities, first blast in the capital occurred next to a 14-seater matatu, or public minibus, and the second was inside a shop in Gikomba Market close to Nairobis central business district. Al Shabaab are suspected as perpetrators. Preceding the attack the British government had issued a travel advisory due to threats. Police forces launch a manhunt operation for the perpetrators the following day.

At least three people were killed and 60 wounded when bombs exploded in two buses on a busy highway in the Kenyan capital Nairobi. Both explosions took place around 5.45pm. There was no immediate claim of responsibility for the attacks -- although Kenyan authorities are currently engaged in a major security crackdown on suspected supporters of neighbouring Somalias Al-Qaeda-linked Shebab rebels. This comes a day after a similar attack in Mombasa. Several suspected were arrested in connection with the blasts within the week.

Three simultaneous blasts occur in the Somali populated Eastleigh district. At least six are dead and scores injured. Al Shabaab are suspected. In the days following the explosion police arrest over 650 possible suspects.
A man is dead after the explosive device he was assembling detonated during construction. Police suspect "sympathizers of Somali Islamic extremists."

A blast of unknown origin occurs at Jomo Kenyatta International Airport during the evening hours. The body of a Somali national was later discovered, however his causes of death is believed to be from gunfire. Nevertheless, authorities believe his death is related to the blast perpetrators. The following three days several arrests were made.
One person is injured after suspected al Shabaab detonated an explosive in the Somali-populated Eastleigh district of Nairobi.

Suspected al Shabaab attackers detonate an explosive on a public bus, killing four and injuring 30 in the Pangani-Eastleigh section of the city. Eastleigh is known for its large population of ethnic Somalis, and may have been the specific target of the attackers. In the following days the death toll from the blast rose to six.
Bomb in Eastleigh injures one; Somali man arrested and charged in the attack
Al Shabaab continues to hold hostages for the third day while remain holed up in the Westgate Mall.
Al-Shabaab continues to shoot and execute civilians within Westgate Mall.
Source: The Star; Agence France Presse; NYPD Report; BBC

Notes: Al Shabaab attacks pedestrians in a shopping centre during mid-day, arriving in three separate groups using three different entrances. 68 dead, including private security staff, 150+ injured over four days, hostages taken. Witnesses claim the attack was highly organised, with the attackers having pre-positioned weapons throughout the building, as well as obtaining access to service elevators. Following the attack al Shabaab claimed responsibility. There were claims the group specifically targeted non-Muslims. Foreigners were among those confirmed dead, including British, American, French, Canadians, Indians, a Ghanaian, a South African and a Chinese. The ordeal occurred over a four day period. Al Shabaab stated the reason for the attacks was the Kenyan military presence in Somalia.
Al Shabaab-linked suspects throw grenade, injuring several civilians
Police arrest 29 Ugandan terror suspected who they believed were traveling to Somalia to join Al Shabaab. The arrests occurred in the Kasarani neighborhood of Nairobi.
Explosion blamed on Al Shabaab injures civilians in Nairobi
Explosion blamed on Al Shabaab injures civilians in Nairobi
Twin blasts in Eastleigh target civilians
Al Shabaab operative gives explosive device disquised as gas cylinder to man to ferry, then remotely detonates the device. The man ferrying the gas cylinder was hospitalized with injuries
IED detonated in downtown Nairobi on Moi Avenue injuring 38 people. Al Shabaab or AS sympathizer suspected. One person later died in hospital.
Recruitment: Al Shabaab said to be recruiting Kenyans from slums of Nairobi
Grenade attack outside mosque by unknown group; police blame Al Shabaab
Grenade attack at mosque kills five; Al Shabaab involvement suspected
Grenade attack blamed on Al Shabaab injures civilians and kills one
Al Shabaab detonates grenade in bus filled with civilians; ten killed
Grenade attack on church blamed on Al Shabaab

Local media reported an Al Shabaab operative gives explosive device disquised as a radio to civilian to hold, then remotely detonates the device. The man holding the device was killed instantly. Reuters stated that the man killed was a suicide bomber who detonated his device early by mistake. Many bystanders were wounded.
Man with suspected ties to Al-Shabab lobs grenade into church, kills 2
Grenade attack blamed on Islamic militants
Police arrest four members of Al Shabaab who planned attacks on churches over Christmas.
Al Shabaab detonates an explosive at an Nairobi disco and injures 14 people.
An explosion ripped through a street in the centre of the Kenyan capital Nairobi on Sunday, injuring dozens of people and sending ambulances and police rushing to the scene. Two people were killed.
Police arrest one man believed to be in connection with the twin bombings. Many weapons were found in the position of the man. He later admitted to be involved with al Shabaab.
At least one person was killed and 10 were wounded Monday in a grenade attack at a bus stop in central Nairobi, the second such incident in less than a day.

A bomb exploded on a bus in central Nairobi Monday during a security search before it left for Kampala, killing three and wounding 23. An official with Kampala Coach Ltd said the would-be attacker was among those wounded or killed by the blast.
Al Qaeda bombs US Embassy in Nairobi, killing 213 Kenyan and American civilians
Kenyan police arrest Ugandans who are reportedly responsible for series of bomb blasts in Uganda

an Arab group that said it was seeking retaliation for Kenya's allowing Israeli troops to refuel in Nairobi during the 1976 raid on Entebbe Airport in Uganda to rescue hostages from a hijacked aircraft.
The Otc bus station

Property destruction: on August 24th, and according to an Al Shabaab commander, the group destroyed power stations in Lamu town and Tana River town (for the latter, the location of Hola has been used). There has been no confirmation of this claim in other sources.
Three suspected Al-Shaabab militants were killed in a gun battle with police in Tana River County on Monday.

Property destruction: Al-Shabab fighters attacked the Kenyan village of Gamba in Tana River County [in the country's coastal region], targeting government installations in the area. The extent of the damage or whether anyone was killed or injured in the attack is not year clear. Phone networks in the area broke down after the raid.

Al Shabaab militants ambushed a vehicle travelling from Garsen to Lamu. The vehicle drove over an IED and was then shot at by the militants. 2 people were killed. 50m away, a few hours later, the same Al Shabaab militants fired at a truck, killing 1 person. They also destroyed a nearby electricity pylon.
Three Al-Shabaab militants shot dead a Tana River County Assembly driver on Friday
UPDF accused of bombing Turkana pastoralists in Nakwanye (Nakwanga) and Morutorong in August. 71 killed.

On September 11th, a police vehicle belonging to the Anti-Stock Theft Unit was hit by an explosion in Kotulo ward (Wajir). They began searching for suspects afterwards. There were no reports of police injuries or deaths.

On 16th July, an IED intended to target Kenya soldiers exploded after their vehicle had passed the device, on the road between Tarbaj and Kutulo (Tarbaj coded as the location, with coordinates of the site of the attack accurate to 3km taken from the source). There were no casualties, and the source attributes the attack to Al Shabaab.

Actor1: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
Notes: 17 June. An al Shabaab IED detonated in Tarbaj, killing 8 GSU police officers. Al Shabaab claims 15 fatalities. Following the attack al Shabaab took the officer's weapons and fled.
IED targets Kenya Police land cruiser headed to location of previous al Shabaab attack near Kutulo. No casualties & no damages.
Suspected al-Shabab militants have destroyed a Safaricom communication mast in Kutulo, Wajir County.
Al Shabaab fighters attack Qarsa Primary School in Wajir. Three teachers killed, one injured. Assailants escaped.
15/02, PM Wajir: Al Shabaab attack a school killing 3 teachers.
Al Shabaab militants who attempted to carry out an attack were driven out by the officers from the Rural Border Patrol Unit on Monday.
Nine Kenyan soldiers were killed, and ten others were injured when a road side bomb explosed. Al Shabaab confirmed claimed responsibility of the attack.
On Monday, a team of security officers escaped an IED explosion unhurt as they hunted down a group of al-Shabab militants who had planted landmines in Gerille area, Wajir County.
Property destruction: Al Shabaab militants destroyed a communications mast in Wajir

Movement of forces: Forty-five members of al Shabaab are witnessed crossing into Kenya at Sugrow, Wajir County. One group of 13 was sighted headed towards Gerille, another towards Konton and another towards Gumarey areas of Wajir East.
At least two people were killed and some others injured by suspected al-Shabaab who vandalized a communication mast in the Tarbaj area near the border with Somalia.
Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed a chief of Erib location in Wajir on 20/06.

Suspected al Shabaab opened fire at a residential area of Wajir on 06/06, killing three persons. Officials and residents said the attackers were believed to have been seeking to kill a local administrator who lives close to the scene of the attack and is known to be on an al Shabaab "wanted" list for speaking out against the sects activities in the region.
Al Shabaab attack, and then later claim responsibility for the death of four in Wajir. Three other injured.
At least one patron is killed when suspected al Shabaab attack a country club bar in Wajir. Witnesses claim two blasts followed by gunfire.

Two people were killed and at least three others injured in two explosions targeting police officers in the north-eastern Kenyan town of Wajir. The explosions took place near the Baraza park in the town. The injured were taken to Wajir general hospital. Reports say there have been several arrests in connection with the explosions.
Kenyan police intercept Al Shabaab truck carrying explosives in northeastern Kenya
Gunmen linked to Al Shabaab kill two on road to Garissa
One person was killed and three wounded in a blast outside a restaurant in the northeastern Kenyan town of Wajir
Grenade attack on restaurant in Wajir region wounds five
Nine military officers injured and one police officer killed in twin al Shabaab explosions.
A grenade wounds six in a border town. Residents and authorities suspect Al Shabaab.
Al Shabaab attacked a Kenyan border town Dadaj-Bula, opened fire on the residents, wounding seven of them.
Security forces attack Islamic militants who had attempted to kidnap nun
Somali Islamists attack and try to kidnap Catholic nun
Ethiopian rebel group hurls bomb into Kenyan homestead

1 civilian confirmed killed and 4 injured during alleged bombing by UPDF against armed Pokot herders within the Kenyan border. 2 women and 3 children missing, assumed to be abducted and held at Loro barracks.

Alleged shelling by Uganda Peoples Defence Force (UPDF) inside the Kenyan border linked to disarmament operation and pursuit of armed Pokot herders. Full casualty count unkonwn. 800 cattle impounded by UPDF. FATALITIES = TOTAL FOR 4 DAYS CONFLICT - (Rec
Source: All Africa (AFNWS) 03/07/2007, Reuters News (LBA) 05/07/2007, BBC Monitoring Newsfil (BBCMNF) 19/07/2007

Notes: Alleged shelling by Uganda Peoples Defence Force (UPDF) inside the Kenyan border linked to disarmament operation and pursuit of armed Pokot herders. Full casualty count unkonwn. 800 cattle impounded by UPDF. FATALITIES = TOTAL FOR 4 DAYS CONFLICT - (Rec
Source: All Africa (AFNWS) 03/07/2007, Reuters News (LBA) 05/07/2007, BBC Monitoring Newsfil (BBCMNF) 19/07/2007

Source: All Africa (AFNWS) 03/07/2007, Reuters News (LBA) 05/07/2007, BBC Monitoring Newsfil (BBCMNF) 19/07/2007

Notes: Alleged shelling by Uganda Peoples Defence Force (UPDF) inside the Kenyan border linked to disarmament operation and pursuit of armed Pokot herders. Full casualty count unkonwn. 800 cattle impounded by UPDF. FATALITIES = TOTAL FOR 4 DAYS CONFLICT - (Rec
Source: All Africa (AFNWS) 03/07/2007, Reuters News (LBA) 05/07/2007, BBC Monitoring Newsfil (BBCMNF) 19/07/2007

Notes: 25 September 2018: Al-Shabaab forces reportedly killed a Kenyan soldier in Lamu county (location unspecified by the source).

In Ishakani Village in Lamu East, more than 100 heavily armed insurgents took over the area and preached radical teachings to the residents. They hoisted their flag at a deserted local police station before going back to their hideouts. Sources revealed that the attackers have also been conducting daily prayers at mosques in the area at will.

On August 29th, five Kenyan soldiers were killed and ten wounded when their vehicle hit a landmine on the road between Kiunga and Sankuri (Lamu, coordinates for Kiunga used). It was not clear who had planted the device, though a pro-Al Shabaab radio station in Somalia subsequently claimed that Al Shabaab had killed at least 20 Kenyan soldiers in an (unverified) attack in the area of Lamu, which was reported to be an ambush. Until further information comes to light, this has been coded as a single event of remote violence by an unknown group, killing five.

Eight people including four school children and four police officers were killed in a roadside bomb attack planted by suspected Al Shabaab fighters that occurred in Kiunga, Lamu on Tuesday. The police officers were escorting the school children to Kiunga from Mararani, when the lorry was hit by an IED. Following the blast, al Shabaab opened fire on the victims.

Two soldiers from Kenya Defence forces were killed, and another wounded in an IED explosion. Al-Shabaab claimed responibility of the attack. Another IED exploded in the same area on the same day before a Kenyan vehicle passed, leaving the passengers unharmed.
An explosive device aimed at a military lorry went off between Kiunga and Ishakani. It exploded early and there were no casualties.
The Kenyan security forces rescued 2 of the 4 pupils kidnapped during the Al Shabaab attack on Kiunga two days previously. No reports of clashes.
Suspected al Shabaab detonate an explosive at a police building injuring one officer.
A KDF convoy runs over a al Shabaab-planted landmine in Ishakani, five injured.

Three Nyumba Kumi officials were assassinated by gunmen in Diani, Kwale County [coast region] on Sunday [29 May]. The perpetrators are believed to be al Shabaab. The three were killed separately, each in their homes.
Mombasa county government chief inspector of Logistic and Planning is shot and killed, along with his companion. The assailants are believed to be of or in league with al Shabaab.

Suspected Al Shabaab killed a British man and kidnapped his wife in a raid on a remote beach resort known as Kiwayu Safari Village. The Kenyan military mobilizes troops along the border with Somalia in response.
